values:
was excellent.  Pictures to follow.

Perfect blend of maximum enjoyment and being happy to be home.

Had a good day shooting yesterday.  Shot 4 rounds of maze clays. did pretty well.  Missed at least one everytime I called for a true pair.  Kind of irritating.  Decided to go up to bob and leai's for dinner with cat.  I worry I may have screwed up my skeet game a little bit.

After dinner, I was napping on the couch and the phone rang.  Caller-id said it was Travis's cell phone.  Surprised, I picked up the phone, it in fact was Travis.  He nonchalantly said hello.  I told him I was happy to hear that he was alive.  He seemed surprised at my concern.  

Appearantly he just needed to get out of town to clear his head a little bit.  And had left the country for a couple of weeks.  Completely unaware that not telling anyone including his family, or his work(family business) that he was leaving town would create some twinge of panic.
What a f-ing moron.

His parents called me looking for him, fearing the worst I'm sure.  And he seems as usual completely oblivious.  
One positive note, he said that he hasn't had a drink for a few months.   That's a step in the right direction for sure.

Still, pretty unbelievable, all in all.

So, I just bought a Baretta 686 White Onyx 
Expensive hobby number 3, in the bag...

ExpensiveHobby1 = Motorcycles
ExpensiveHobby2 = Golf

I guess we'll see how this goes.  Hopefully I'll at least shoot something that is worth eating come winter time...  and break a few clays in the meantime.

From  the top of a box of shotgun shells...

"WARNING - KEEP OUT of reach of children and incompetent people"

That just tickled the heck outta me!

Have had some strange dreams here on vacation...
Mostly about the markets.

Had a dream about arbitrage in the S&P futures.  Like having them trade below intrinsic value intraday...  very odd.
Some other market realted dream fragments.  Nothing coherent enough to write down.

It wasn't pretty, but I got it done.
3:22
http://www.totalracesolutions.com/2008/Mar/seasidehalfage.html

Not sure if I've got a full marathon in me or not.
"jesus is coming, bitch.  better look busy."

I heard the best hiphop lyric in quite some time, on album 88 this afternoon.

"You couldn't hold me back if you was a Jamaican chiropractor"

hillarious.

Perfect score....


Prof Gilzot: Are you ready to take the "Are You Smarter Than A 5th Grader?" Test?
glyphard: yes
Prof Gilzot: Here we go and good luck glyphard!!!
...
Prof Gilzot: Not bad glyphard you answered 28 of the questions correctly.

It's nice to not feel burnt out about writing software.  I was really worried that I'd completely lost interest in it.

The other day I finally had enough of the spam in my blind forward box, and decided to do something about it. 
It's a little klunky, but it works pretty well.  Doesn't respect the "no news is good gnus" principle, in that it's a bit chatty on stdout, but hey it works.  It runs every five minutes in a cron job.  Plus it got me back into java again.  I'm looking forward to writing some fun apps next year.

It's nice to work on software again, and actually be genuinely interested in it.

As grad school draws to a close, this last project based on the model in this paper is really really giving me a hard time:
http://129.3.20.41/eps/fin/papers/0501/0501011.pdf

what a f-ing drag!

trading ands presidents...

It cracks me up to watch the ticker on an index go down the instant the president gets on CNBC...

Then it jumps up right after he gets off the air.

we're back from mexico.   a sad existential realization....  vacation does not actually solve any of the problems that you leave behind when you go on vacation.

However, it does give you some much needed perspective.  That counts for a lot.


We did in fact have a blast.  Got in early on friday, since we got lucky and made an earlier flight in guadalajarra.
Checked in on friday and didn't leave the property until monday morning to leave for the airport.

Drank by the pool all day saturday and sunday.  In fact we skipped breakfast on sunday and beat the waiters to the pool.  Got lawnchairs with great views.  Mild sunburns all around... just enough to look healthy on return.

9 weeks left in the semester and counting.

werd.

Cat and I are headed out for a long weekend in Mexico.

we're staying at a Marriot in Puerto Vallarta. 

Hopefully it's nicer than the Residence Inn in Cleveland, the last marriot property I stayed in.

I ran the 5k  @ the East Atlanta Strut this morning.  It was pretty fun.  I actually came up 5 bucks short on my entry fee.  They still let me race.  That was nice of them.  If they have a charity, I'll donate the other 5 bucks to it.  I finished the 5k in 38:55.  Not that great, but better than sleeping in, I suppose.  The first place finisher did it in something like 19 minutes....  Basically twice as fast.  But if you take weight divided by time, and rank on that, I'm sure I would finish somewhere closer to the top.  Too bad that's an irrelevant statistic.  :-(

It was super fun though.  3 miles is the distance that I run 3 times a week, so it wasn't a big deal.  The terrain and the air made it more difficult, hence the slower time.  I can normally do that distance in 33 minutes.  But when you run on a flat surface all the time, even the slightest hill will crush you.

I had to walk twice during the race, which isn't so great, but I did make a determination to run up each and every hill.  Which i came through on.  With as heavy as I am I just can't take the jarring on pavement from running downhill.  It always feels good to breeze by people going up hill when they had to stop running because of the incline.

Anyways, time to take my runner's high and go help a client diagnose a software issue.


werd.

remember when I wrote this application 5 or 6 years ago, back in the vinctura fulton cotton mill loft days?
 Fucking Classic!
 
 http://www.telespoof.com/

Market Risk Remains To The Downside

When have you ever heard the phrase:  "Market Risk Remains to the UPSIDE"?

Like that is supposed to be news.  Financial journalism is hillarious.

I had the strangest dream early this morning...

I dreamed that I was going to some small gym, and for some reason I had to take Indie(the cat) with me.  I had him in this black cloth bag.  And for the most part he was just chillin.  But when I got in there he started wriggling around and trying to get out.  I woke up right as the gym monitor person came over to give me a hard time about having a cat in a gym. 

Very strange.

Also, this is funny:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sAA28sfKmiY

Market volatility today.  Helps add some premium in the option chain.  Bad day if you're owned mutual funds I guess. 

In other news, 
meow214
  made the most awesome rotini pesto last night...  from the basil plant that mom bought at the grocery store a couple of weeks ago.  I think it had miracle grow on it or something because it started as this little tiny plant and is now a hulking behemoth of basilness that dominates the back porch.  Well, not really, but it is surprisingly large.  We mixed in some canned tuna at the end, and it was super delicious.  Really blew me away.  I added a little vinaigrette(rice wine vinegar) at the table and it was f-ing awesome!  The salad was good too...

Mostly finished the stepstool that I was initially planning on giving
meow214
 for xmas.  Just in time for her birthday.  I think i'll put a coat of paste wax on it before I deliver it to her.  Need to pick up a card, and think of one more thing to get for her.  Racking my brain, but all I come up with is a trip to vegas, and I can't really swing that right now  :-(.

pretty interesting technology that microsoft bought...

also new buzzword that cracked me up:

metaverse 

I guess I should read more sci-fi books.

glyphard: my super-sneaky-firewall-getter-arounder-doo-dad-watchamacallit broke the other day  :-(
glyphard: it started telling me that I my http request was not being authenticated by the proxy server (err407)...
glyphard: which I could understand except for the fact that it had been working just fine, and had proxy auth code in it....
glyphard: some UPS f-er must have changed something having to do with the UPS http-proxy infrastructure.  What exactly these chowder heads have done is not clear, but I definitely am not getting my heartbeat http request to allow me to remotely request log files.
glyphard: grr!
glyphard: I might have to actually go in more than once a week now.  sucks!

in other news, this cracked me up this morning:

how does an optimist refer to a glass with no water in it?
it is an odd feeling to look in a trading account, see minus signs, in the change column, and have that be a good thing.

had a wonderful trip to costa rica last week. 
lots of not so great pics here.

good group, had a great time.  lived like a king.  didn't want to come home :-(

Sucessfully cleared the bills/mounting paperwork off of my desk.

Built the beginnings of a neat trading application to use at interactive brokers.
annoying asynchronous setup and everything.


had a thought about news vs gossip.  What is the difference, or when does gossip become news and the other way around.  I think that for the most part they are the same.  I started with thinking that maybe gossip has some inherent malicious intent, but news has that as well.  It seems like the only way to distinguish them is the interest.  If you spread gossip about someone or an event and the entire world is interested, it's not gossip.  It's news.  (of course i'm referring only to the alledgedly nonfiction type of gossip)
Not monumental, but gave me a chuckle on the way home.

Just updated the costa rica spreadsheet with an hourly counter.  Looking fwd to that.
grades come out @ 6pm.  hopefully i didn't do worse than a C in any class.

it is sad when you have to sit through a 3-hour exam even though you've said as much as you can meaningfully say in the first 30 minutes...  but the grad school grading policy of detante being what it is, i felt obligated to stick around.  Hopefully i'll get at least a C in derivatives and fixed income.

fixed income monday @ 8am. derivative securities monday @ 11.30 am. numerical methodswednesday @ 11.30am. I have finished all of my projects and now just need to focus and study for fixed income and derivatives. need to make formula sheets and the like for fixed income and get the key examples understood and memorized for derivatives. I cannot wait to be done with classes. Looking forward to trading a building (trading) software this summer. Also I finished the behemoth term paper that I was working on relating to jim cramer's show.

http://imdb.com/title/tt0069451/

wow, amazingly bad!

and the pig scene... whoa brutality.

and like the reviews said, you can barely make out the pink floyd tracks in the background.

amazing let down, similar to most excursions into atypical floyd material.

So, I am writing in lj instead of studying.  Common trend no doubt.  Today I've got my derivative securities midterm.  It is a mixture of simple-but-tedious-and-easy-to-make-simple-computational-errors, and stochastic-calculus-that-you-really-aren't-qualified-to-do,-but-everybody-seems-to-ignore-that-and-just-does-it-anyways type of problems.  I guess we'll see how it goes.

must eat lunch and cram.  

werd.

OpenSource: +0 Me: +1 I managed to download seekafile 1.5 source beta and get it running. I also wrote some code to search +1GB of outlook mail for pdf files, pipe them through OCR, and then index them. Now I can search all of my incoming faxes(pdf's) or anything else for that matter in a nice quick little search engine that even gives me query highlights in the results. It took 3days, replacing a lot of the source with updated packages. Seriously, why do microsoft OSS developers not use CVS(or something else that can be used over the net), and an automated build process? GRRRR! If you can't build it on a new machine from the src zip, why would you add the word 'beta' next to it?

Had an idea for a new lj metric to measure relative cool/hipness of individual LJ's.

lj-cool factor =  count(friends-of) / count(friends)

The higher the number the cooler/hipper an lj is.  The lower the number the more of a loser you are.  Obviously i'm a looser since I have an lj-cool factor of less than one.

somewhat negative, but could be well received among the 'livejournal is a service that is populare among teenage girls' (news comment about livejournal during the MySpace aquisition mania).
A good read if you've never been part of a shifty exchange.(not sure if you can see it without subscription)
Almost all of my classes this semester made me think of the following: Science uses theory to move from known to unknown. Finance uses theory to move from one expectation to another.

the final final of fall 2006 is in one hour. I can't wait for it to be over. of course it's the hardest one. of course I have a 52 average going into it. of course, of course, of course... I managed to get 15 weeks of notes to fit onto a doublesided 8.5x11 sheet of paper. didn't have room for definition of a martingale or standard brownian motion, but i figure if i can't remember those, i'm pretty much fukt! it amazes me how the world of mathematical finance is all predicated on assumptions that are pretty much not realistic. anyways, time to shower and bolt out to the exam. Tonight i'm going to get a steak and get chrunk! werd. PS: Bring on the masochism that is spring semester!

Financial Optimization Models exam tomorrow morning.  Hopefully it's not as tough as the last midterm was.  I've got to get the constraint tightening thing figured out.  Also, i'm not feeling so good about, "it's a three hour exam.  Don't expect to spend it all writing.  you'll spend most of the three hours thinking"  Doesn't sound good.

Stochastcis exam on wednesday.  TA says that it's going to be very difficult.  well, much more difficult than the sample final.  grrrr! I don't like the sound of that.

we'll see what happens.


Update:

I just watched my neighbor across the street chase his 3 year old daughter around with a leaf blower while gathering up leaves.  Pretty funny.

it hurts my heart when I see an otherwise talented chef make a fancy marinade and then drown a prime cut of meet in it. Why? A filet just needs salt and pepper at most. Save your mango chili applebee's crap for the round, or the flank, or some other part of the cow that is in the under $5/pound retail price range. A filet is such a fine tasting piece of beef... it really is a shame to mask that in any way.
complete.  cathy and I now own our very first home together.  let the fun begin!

No sleep.  Up coding all night.  As usual, got a ton done right up until 3am.  From 3am to 8am was pretty much a waste of time.  Should've spent that time sleeping.  When will I learn?  

I really should just make my computer just shutdown at 3am everyday regardless of what's going on.

Well, I guess it's time for breakfast and a nap before school.  Sooo.... sleepy.  Can barely carry on coherent conversation.

sometimes I read job posting boards, not because i'm searching a job, but because it sometimes has the same effect as staring at a picture of a serene beach scene in the dead of winter. I'm in school so can't take a job, but it's fun to look sometimes... I was peeking around on the joel job board and found the best candidate requirement i've seen yet: Requirements: Enthusiasm for solving interesting problems. of course it was at google doing something that i'm likely not qualified for, but i'm definitely adding it to my objective in my general resume. It pretty much sums up all that i've ever wanted from work, the opportunity to work on interesting problems.

a tool that takes the csv files from wrds/compustat and turns them into a standardized balance sheet income statement in a spreadsheet. It also allows the user to select a valuation xls and then merges the two together so that one can use a template with all of the relevant valuation formulas in it and then with a few clicks have an entirely new valuation analysis for a new company. No copy/paste, no formatting issues, fewer errors, and less time wasted. Relies on having Windows, .Net v1.1+ and Excel 8.0+ installed. (I've tried to wrap as much exception handling in there as possible, since it tries to launch excel when it's done, there's a strong likelyhood that something somewhere will break. ) Release: Alpha v0.1 Leave a comment if you find a bug. Maybe i'll fix it.

I was sleeping so cozilly this morning.  The maid came earlier this week and switched me from summer sheets to winter flannel sheets and then it got relatively cold.  Good call.  I was having a strange dream involving a t-shirt quilt.  I wish such a thing really existed and that I had one  :)
I just read an article about statistically significant phrase  analysis while sitting on the train and watching cars sit in a sea of rushhours.  Bri

So, i've had 2 or 3 firefox windows open with 10 to 20 tabs each for the better part of a week on a machine with 2BG of ram.  I was trying to click a link and nothing would happen.  I could scroll up and down, move to a different window, but clicking links/buttons just didn't do anything.  So, finally I closed everything and noticed that firefox was still hanging around even though the windows were gone, and it was using 200MB of ram.  No performance degradation, just wierd behavior.  Oh well, I guess there is some firefox-JS memory leak in at least one of the sites that I left open all week, or there is a memory leak in the windows binary, or a memory leak in windows.  Hmm, wonder what the most likely candidate is?  :-P

So time passes and the mess of paperwork on my desk gets more and more out of control.  In a clear line of studying-procrastination, i've decided to clear off the desk.  What do I find a quarter of the way through, under my digital camera?



80 bucks.

kickass!

holy f-ing tired...
1.10 am and i'm just now leaving school.  wow.

finally got the cellphone situation semi satisfactorally resolved.  Immediatedly ordered unlocked replacement phone off of ebay.  And realized that I could borrow a phone from carrie since her and her dad sell used ones on ebay.  Perfect.  Phone was pretty schwag, but worked well.  Was glad to get the new phone.  Finally got all of my numbers back up and running, and backed up as well.

phew!

werd.

It has been almost a full 24 hours of no telephone access.  Last night I turned off my phone and put it on the charger and it beeped a message that said 'unable to charge.'  So I turned it on and it said 'insert sim.'

Several incantations of remove battery, remove sim, clean contacts on sim, reassemble phone, and turn on produced the same message.  1 phone call to cingular, and 45 minutes of waiting in a store produced a new sim card that has the same problems.

After getting to UPS i ordered an unlocked one off of ebay.  It'll be here in 4 days.  It really amazes me how dependent the world has become on cellphones... well, my world at least.  There is a slight twinge of panic that accompanies all new, or seemingly new, situations.  But I can't get over how free it feels to know that the phone is going to ring and suddenly interrupt whatever i'm doing or working on.

It is however a drag to have to remember to check my voicemail...

We'll see how it goes.  planning on sleeping like a baby tonight.

werd.

Unfortunately there is no way to capture the suckage that is riding a motorcycle in the rain, nor the splendor or tight turns. :-( Monday/Wednesday walking route @ georgia tech. Tuesday/Thursday walking route @ georgia tech. 2 miles in 105 DEG F @ 90% humidity as close to running as possible, while still walking, is not as fun as it sounds.
